primary.comment: Primary text such as page headings.

secondary.comment: Secondary text such as labels and section headings.

tertiary.comment: Tertiary text such as supporting text and paragraph text.

quaternary.comment: Quaternary text for more subtle and lower-contrast text, such as footer column headings.

white.comment: Text that is always white, regardless of the mode.

disabled.comment: Default color for disabled text such as disabled input fields or buttons. This can be changed to gray-400, but gray-500 is higher contrast and more accessible.

placeholder.comment: Default color for placeholder text such as input field placeholders. This can be changed to gray-400, but gray-500 is more accessible because it is higher contrast.

error.comment: Default error state semantic text color (e.g. input field error states.

warning.comment: Default warning state semantic text color.

success.comment: Default success state semantic text color.

primary.comment: High contrast borders. These are used for components such as input fields, button groups, and checkboxes.

secondary.comment: Medium contrast borders. This is the most commonly used border color and is the default for most components (such as file uploaders), cards (such as tables), and content dividers.

tertiary.comment: Low contrast borders useful for very subtle dividers and borders such as line and bar chart axis dividers.

disabled.comment: Default disabled border color for disabled states in components such as input fields and checkboxes.

error.comment: Default error state semantic border color. Useful for error states in components such as input fields and file uploaders.

primary.comment: Highest contrast non-text foreground elements such as icons.

secondary.comment: High contrast non-text foreground elements such as icons.

tertiary.comment: Medium contrast non-text foreground elements such as icons.

quaternary.comment: Medium-low contrast non-text foreground elements such as icons.

quinary.comment: Low contrast non-text foreground elements such as help icons.

senary.comment: Lowest contrast non-text foreground elements such as breadcrumb divider icons and vector map. Used very sparingly.

white.comment: Foreground elements that are always white, regardless of the mode.

disabled.comment: Default color for disabled non-text foreground elements such as icons in disabled button group buttons and input dropdown menu items.

error.comment: Default color for disabled non-text foreground elements such as icons in disabled button group buttons and input dropdown menu items.

warning.comment: Default color for disabled non-text foreground elements such as icons in disabled button group buttons and input dropdown menu items.

success.comment: Default color for disabled non-text foreground elements such as icons in disabled button group buttons and input dropdown menu items.

primary.comment: The primary background color (white) used across all layouts and components.

secondary.comment: The secondary background color used to create contrast against white backgrounds, such as website section backgrounds.

tertiary.comment: The tertiary background color used to create contrast against light backgrounds such as toggles.

quaternary.comment: The quaternary background color used to create contrast against light backgrounds, such as sliders and progress bars.

disabled.comment: Default disabled background color for components such as disabled primary buttons and toggles.

overlay.comment: Default background color for background overlays. These are useful for overlay components such as modals.

error-primary.comment: Primary error state background color for components.

error-secondary.comment: Secondary error state background color for components such as featured icons.

error-solid.comment: Default solid (dark) error state background color for components such as featured icons and metric items.

warning-primary.comment: Primary warning state background color for components.

warning-secondary.comment: Secondary warning state background color for components such as featured icons.

warning-solid.comment: Default solid (dark) warning state background color for components such as featured icons.

success-primary.comment: Primary success state background color for components.

success-secondary.comment: Secondary success state background color for components such as featured icons.

success-solid.comment: Default solid (dark) success state background color for components such as featured icons and metric items.
